channel.title: Adding Custom's Help
channel.description:
I Have Donator Cape Ready To Add. it came with a folder 5.gz wich is animatedcapeagainb.dat 4.gz GreenWhiteB.Dat Int
What Do i Do Where Do i Place Please Help?

item.title: Adding Custom's Help
item.dc:creator: @bibbobbib bibbobbib
item.description:
@bibbobbib wrote:

you need the model in your model folder first of all. make sure u leave it as the same format as all the other models for example: if they are all .dat files you need to unzip the .gz file mostly they will be .gz files.

you will need to look up a int for you’re model if you find an int for you’re cape then paste it into you’re class8.java file if you have one then when its pasted go into items.java and find where it says public static int capes[] = { 2677,2680,####
the “####” is you’re item Id. just add you’re item Id after the last number. make sure this number is in the class8.java file

if(i == ####) { class8.aStringArray189 = new String[5]; class8.aStringArray189[1] = "Equip"; // String name, this can be changed to wield, or attach, or whatever you want class8.anInt174 = @@@@; // Drop/Inv Model class8.anInt165 = @@@@; // Male Wield Model class8.anInt200 = @@@@; // Female Wield class8.anInt188 = -1; // Male arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt164 = -1; // Female arms/sleeves (Leave as -1 if not used) class8.anInt181 = 400; // Zoom - Increase to make inv model smaller class8.anInt190 = 498; // Rotate up/down - Increase to rotate upwards class8.anInt198 = 1300; // Rotate right/left - Increase to rotate right class8.anInt169 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move right class8.anInt194 = -1; // Position in inv, increase to move up class8.aString170 = "Donator Cape";// Item Name class8.aByteArray178 = "A Worn by Donators.".getBytes(); // Item Examine }

the “@”'s are the item model numbers and the #### is the item id i don’t know if this will work for you’re client. next time you ask a question specify what the client base is and if its 317, 508, 614 ect.[size=18pt]Make sure you copy you’re files before trying this because it may not work[/size]

Hope this helped ~Bibbobbib~

Read full topic
